chief_complaint: feeling hopeless for 3 months
hpi_full: 32F presents with persistent depressed mood, anhedonia, insomnia, poor concentration, and passive suicidal ideation without plan for 3 months. Triggered by divorce.
character: Pervasive sadness, emptiness, crying spells
associated_symptoms: Passive SI: 'Sometimes I wonder if everyone would be better off without me'

social_history.alcohol: 1-2 glasses wine on weekends, increased recently

physical_exam.neuro: Flat affect, slow speech, coherent thought process

primary_diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder, severe, single episode

chief_complaint: headache and blurry vision at 34 weeks pregnant
hpi_full: 29F G2P1 at 34w2d presents with severe headache, visual changes, and RUQ pain for 6 hours. BP 165/105. Concern for preeclampsia with severe features.
character: Throbbing, diffuse headache with 'sparkles' in vision

physical_exam.general: Anxious, gravid female in moderate distress
physical_exam.abdomen: Gravid uterus consistent with dates, RUQ tenderness
physical_exam.extremities: 2+ pitting edema bilateral LE, facial edema

primary_diagnosis: Preeclampsia with severe features, possible HELLP

chief_complaint: can't stop washing my hands, takes hours every day
hpi_full: 24M presents with worsening contamination obsessions and handwashing compulsions over 6 months. Now spending 4+ hours/day on rituals, unable to work effectively.
onset: 6 months ago, gradual worsening after COVID pandemic
character: Intrusive thoughts about contamination, fear of spreading disease
ros_positive: Weight loss from avoiding eating out

physical_exam.hands: Severely dry, cracked, erythematous skin bilateral hands

primary_diagnosis: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder, contamination subtype, severe

chief_complaint: vomiting and confusion for 1 day
hpi_full: 19M Type 1 diabetic presents with 1 day of nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and progressive confusion. Ran out of insulin 3 days ago due to cost.
onset: 1 day ago, nausea started 3 days ago
duration: 1 day of vomiting, 3 days without insulin
character: Diffuse abdominal pain, nausea, progressive obtundation
medications: Insulin glargine 20u daily (RAN OUT 3 DAYS AGO)

physical_exam.general: Lethargic, dry mucous membranes, fruity breath

primary_diagnosis: Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA), severe
correct_treatment: Switch to SubQ insulin when AG closes
Social work consult for insulin access

chief_complaint: worst headache of my life
hpi_full: 45F presents with sudden-onset severe headache during exercise, associated with neck stiffness and photophobia. Concern for subarachnoid hemorrhage.
onset: 1 hour ago, sudden thunderclap onset during yoga
character: Explosive, thunderclap, never experienced before
associated_symptoms: Brief loss of consciousness at onset

physical_exam.neuro: GCS 14, nuchal rigidity, no focal deficits

available_imaging.CT Head non-contrast: Diffuse subarachnoid blood in basal cisterns, Fisher Grade 3

primary_diagnosis: Aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (Hunt-Hess Grade 2)
correct_workup: If CT negative: LP for xanthochromia

chief_complaint: sudden shortness of breath and chest pain
hpi_full: 35F presents with acute-onset pleuritic chest pain and dyspnea 2 days after a 14-hour flight. On oral contraceptives.
character: Sharp, pleuritic, right-sided

physical_exam.extremities: Right calf 3cm larger than left, tender, positive Homan sign

available_imaging.CTA Chest: Segmental PE in right lower lobe, saddle embolus extending to bilateral main pulmonary arteries
available_imaging.Lower extremity US: Acute DVT in right popliteal and femoral veins
available_imaging.Echo: RV dilation, RV/LV ratio 1.2, McConnell sign

primary_diagnosis: Submassive pulmonary embolism with RV strain

chief_complaint: high fever, severe headache, stiff neck
hpi_full: 20M college student in dormitory presents with rapid onset high fever, severe headache, neck stiffness, and photophobia over 12 hours. Petechial rash on trunk.
severity: 8/10 headache, feels like he's going to die
character: Severe headache, neck stiffness, cannot bend chin to chest

physical_exam.neuro: Nuchal rigidity, positive Kernig and Brudzinski signs, GCS 14
physical_exam.skin: Petechial rash on trunk and extremities, some purpuric lesions

available_labs.CSF: WBC 2800 (95% PMN), protein 320, glucose 18 (serum 110), gram stain: gram-negative diplococci

primary_diagnosis: Bacterial meningitis (Neisseria meningitidis)
correct_workup: CT head before LP if indicated

chief_complaint: brought by family for not sleeping and bizarre behavior
hpi_full: 28M brought by wife. Has not slept for 4 days, spent $15,000 on online shopping, quit his job to 'start a billion-dollar company', talking rapidly, irritable when challenged.
duration: 5 days of decreasing sleep, now 0 hours for 2 days
character: Euphoric/irritable mood, grandiosity, pressured speech
alleviating: Nothing — patient doesn't think anything is wrong
past_medical_history: Depression diagnosed at age 22 (treated with SSRI)

social_history.alcohol: Reports none recently but wife says he drank heavily 2 days ago
social_history.drugs: Denies, but wife suspects cocaine use

physical_exam.neuro: Alert, oriented x3 but tangential, rapid speech, no focal deficits
physical_exam.psych: Euphoric > irritable mood, labile affect, grandiose delusions, no auditory/visual hallucinations, poor insight/judgment

primary_diagnosis: Bipolar I Disorder, manic episode with psychotic features, likely SSRI-precipitated

chief_complaint: sudden lower abdominal pain and dizziness
hpi_full: 26F presents with acute-onset left lower quadrant pain, vaginal spotting, and near-syncope. LMP 7 weeks ago. History of prior ectopic pregnancy.
character: Sharp, stabbing, left lower abdomen
past_medical_history: Prior ectopic pregnancy (right, salpingectomy at age 23)

social_history.alcohol: None since found out might be pregnant

physical_exam.abdomen: LLQ tenderness with guarding, rebound positive
physical_exam.pelvic: Cervical motion tenderness, scant dark blood in vault

available_imaging.Transvaginal US: Empty uterus, left adnexal mass 3.2cm with ring of fire sign, moderate free fluid in cul-de-sac

primary_diagnosis: Ruptured left ectopic pregnancy with hemoperitoneum
correct_treatment: Transfusion if Hgb <7 or hemodynamically unstable

chief_complaint: child can't breathe after eating peanut butter
hpi_full: 8M brought by mother with acute-onset facial swelling, urticaria, wheezing, and difficulty breathing 15 minutes after eating a cookie containing peanut butter at a birthday party. Known peanut allergy. EpiPen was at home.
onset: 15 minutes ago after eating peanut butter cookie
character: Throat tightening, can't breathe, full body itching

physical_exam.general: Distressed child, sitting upright, audible stridor
physical_exam.HEENT: Lip and periorbital edema, oropharyngeal edema, muffled voice
physical_exam.chest: Bilateral expiratory wheezing, decreased air entry

primary_diagnosis: Anaphylaxis to peanut, severe (cardiovascular + respiratory involvement)
correct_treatment: Monitor for biphasic reaction (observe 4-6 hours minimum)

chief_complaint: stomach pain (through daughter translating)
hpi_full: 62F Korean-speaking with limited English presents with 2-week history of epigastric pain, weight loss, and early satiety. Daughter translating. Concern for gastric malignancy.
character: Dull, gnawing epigastric pain

social_history.diet: Traditional Korean diet, high salt/pickled foods

physical_exam.general: Thin, appears older than stated age
physical_exam.abdomen: Mild epigastric tenderness, no mass palpable, no hepatomegaly

available_imaging.EGD: 2.5cm ulcerated mass at gastric antrum, biopsy pending

primary_diagnosis: Gastric adenocarcinoma (pending biopsy confirmation)

chief_complaint: heart palpitations and chest tightness, convinced it's myocarditis from vaccine
hpi_full: 22F presents with intermittent palpitations, chest tightness, and dizziness for 1 week. Convinced she has vaccine-induced myocarditis after reading social media posts. Had COVID vaccine 3 months ago. Symptoms consistent with panic attacks.
character: Racing heart, tightness, 'can't get enough air'

physical_exam.heart: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs

available_imaging.Echo: Normal EF 62%, no wall motion abnormalities, normal structure

primary_diagnosis: Panic disorder with health anxiety

chief_complaint: confusion and fever
hpi_full: 78F nursing home resident brought in by staff for acute confusion, fever, and foul-smelling urine. History of recurrent UTIs and indwelling Foley catheter.
onset: Today, noticed by nursing staff this morning
severity: Altered mental status, unable to provide history
character: Acute confusion, lethargy, fever

physical_exam.general: Elderly female, lethargic, arousable to voice
physical_exam.abdomen: Suprapubic tenderness, Foley in place with cloudy malodorous urine

available_imaging.CT Abdomen/Pelvis: Bilateral hydronephrosis, Foley in bladder, no abscess

primary_diagnosis: Urosepsis with septic shock (Sepsis-3 criteria met)
correct_treatment: Broad-spectrum antibiotics within 1 hour (piperacillin-tazobactam or meropenem)
Reassess goals of care with family

chief_complaint: severe back pain, need disability papers
hpi_full: 45M presents requesting disability documentation for chronic low back pain. Workers comp claim pending. Pain descriptions inconsistent with exam findings. Multiple prior ED visits for pain medication.
onset: 6 months ago, after lifting injury at work
character: Burning, stabbing, shooting — 'worst pain imaginable'
associated_symptoms: Claims numbness in all extremities (exam normal)

physical_exam.general: Comfortable in waiting room, distressed on exam
physical_exam.back: Mild paraspinal tenderness, full ROM when distracted, negative SLR bilaterally
physical_exam.neuro: 5/5 strength all extremities, intact sensation, normal reflexes, normal gait when not observed

available_imaging.Lumbar MRI (6 months ago): Mild L4-L5 disc bulge, no nerve root compression, no stenosis

primary_diagnosis: Chronic low back pain with possible secondary gain, Waddell signs positive
correct_treatment: Set clear expectations about disability process

chief_complaint: my son has had fever for 5 days and his eyes are red
hpi_full: 4M brought by mother with 5 days of high fever, bilateral conjunctival injection, rash, swollen red lips, and cervical lymphadenopathy. Classic Kawasaki disease presentation.
duration: 5 days of persistent fever despite acetaminophen
character: Persistent high fever with mucocutaneous changes

physical_exam.HEENT: Bilateral non-purulent conjunctival injection, erythematous cracked lips, strawberry tongue, 2cm right anterior cervical node
physical_exam.extremities: Edema and erythema of hands and feet

primary_diagnosis: Kawasaki Disease (5/5 classic criteria + coronary involvement)
correct_treatment: IVIG 2g/kg single infusion within 10 days of fever onset
High-dose aspirin 80-100mg/kg/day divided q6h until afebrile 48h
Repeat echo at 2 weeks and 6-8 weeks
If IVIG resistant: second IVIG or infliximab

chief_complaint: coughing blood, but I trust God will heal me
hpi_full: 55M presents with 3-week history of hemoptysis, weight loss, and night sweats. Refuses imaging and biopsy citing faith healing. Heavy smoking history. High suspicion for lung cancer.
character: Blood-streaked sputum progressing to frank hemoptysis

physical_exam.chest: Decreased breath sounds right upper lobe, dullness to percussion

available_imaging.CXR: 4cm right upper lobe mass with mediastinal widening

primary_diagnosis: Suspected lung adenocarcinoma with possible mediastinal involvement
correct_treatment: Respect autonomy while providing clear information

chief_complaint: tummy hurts really bad, started around belly button, now on the right side
hpi_full: 14F presents with 18-hour history of periumbilical pain that migrated to RLQ, associated with nausea, vomiting, and low-grade fever. Classic appendicitis migration pattern.
severity: 7/10 now in RLQ, was 5/10 periumbilical initially
character: Sharp, constant, worse with movement

physical_exam.abdomen: RLQ tenderness, positive McBurney, positive Rovsing, positive psoas sign, guarding, no rebound yet

available_imaging.US Abdomen: Non-compressible tubular structure 8mm in RLQ, periappendiceal fat stranding, consistent with acute appendicitis

primary_diagnosis: Acute appendicitis, uncomplicated

chief_complaint: sudden weakness on the right side and can't speak
hpi_full: 72M brought by wife with sudden-onset right-sided weakness, slurred speech, and facial droop starting 1 hour ago while watching TV. Last known well 1 hour ago. NIHSS 14.
severity: Severe — unable to move right arm, speech garbled
character: Sudden right hemiparesis and aphasia
past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation (not on anticoagulation — patient refused)

physical_exam.general: Alert but unable to follow 2-step commands
physical_exam.neuro: NIHSS 14: R facial droop, R arm 0/5, R leg 2/5, global aphasia, left gaze preference, R hemianopia

available_imaging.CT Head non-contrast: No hemorrhage, early hyperdense MCA sign on left
available_imaging.CTA Head/Neck: Left M1 MCA occlusion, good collaterals

primary_diagnosis: Acute ischemic stroke, left MCA territory, large vessel occlusion
correct_treatment: IV tPA if within 4.5h window and no contraindications
Mechanical thrombectomy (LVO within 24h with favorable perfusion)
BP management (permissive HTN, allow <220 pre-tPA, <185 peri-tPA)
Start anticoagulation for AF (timing depends on infarct size)

chief_complaint: here for my child's wellness check but I'm not sure about the vaccines
hpi_full: 30F brings 12-month-old for well-child visit. Child is behind on vaccines (only received birth dose HepB). Mother is vaccine-hesitant after reading online forums. Husband supportive of vaccines.
character: N/A

social_history.living: Two-parent household, one older sibling (also under-vaccinated)

primary_diagnosis: Well child visit with vaccine delay
correct_treatment: Address vaccine concerns with empathy (motivational interviewing)

chief_complaint: I know I need to see a doctor but I can't stand being in hospitals
hpi_full: 38F presents reluctantly with 6-month history of rectal bleeding. Has been avoiding healthcare due to prior medical trauma (painful procedure without adequate anesthesia as a child). PTSD symptoms triggered by medical settings.
severity: Bright red blood on toilet paper, small amounts
character: Painless rectal bleeding with bowel movements
surgical_history: Tonsillectomy at age 6 (traumatic experience — woke during procedure)

physical_exam.general: Anxious, avoidant eye contact, flinches when approached

primary_diagnosis: Rectal bleeding requiring colonoscopy, with medical PTSD as barrier to care
correct_treatment: Mental health referral for medical PTSD

chief_complaint: pain all over my body, nobody can figure out what's wrong
hpi_full: 42F with 2-year history of diffuse pain, fatigue, headaches, GI symptoms, and pelvic pain. Extensive workup negative. Currently going through divorce. Recently lost mother to cancer.
onset: 2 years ago, coinciding with family stressors
character: Multiple sites, multiple types of pain, shifting
location: Head, chest, abdomen, pelvis, joints, muscles
ros_positive: Positive for nearly every system — pain, fatigue, dizziness, palpitations, dyspnea, GI, GU

physical_exam.general: Tearful, multiple tender points but no swelling/inflammation

primary_diagnosis: Somatic symptom disorder with predominant pain
correct_workup: Review prior workup to avoid unnecessary repetition

chief_complaint: I don't feel bonded with my baby, something is wrong with me
hpi_full: 31F 6 weeks postpartum presents with worsening mood, difficulty bonding with newborn, intrusive thoughts of harm to baby (ego-dystonic), severe guilt and anxiety. Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Score 19.
character: Tearfulness, overwhelming anxiety about baby, difficulty sleeping even when baby sleeps
associated_symptoms: Intrusive thoughts of accidentally harming baby (horrified by them)

social_history.support: Husband supportive but working long hours, mother lives out of state

ros_negative: No desire to harm baby or self

physical_exam.neuro: Alert, oriented, coherent thought process, ego-dystonic intrusive thoughts

primary_diagnosis: Postpartum depression with anxiety features, severe
differential_diagnoses: Postpartum psychosis (ruled out — no psychotic symptoms)
correct_workup: Differentiate intrusive thoughts from command hallucinations
correct_treatment: Reassurance that intrusive thoughts are common in PPD
Consider brexanolone if severe and refractory

chief_complaint: I fell at home, my hip hurts
hpi_full: 85F found on floor by home health aide after mechanical fall while getting up from chair. Unable to bear weight on left leg. On anticoagulation for atrial fibrillation.
character: Sharp pain with any movement of left hip/leg
associated_symptoms: Left leg shortened and externally rotated

social_history.living: Lives alone with daily home health aide

physical_exam.general: Elderly female in moderate distress, dehydrated
physical_exam.MSK: Left leg shortened, externally rotated, pain with log roll, groin tenderness

available_imaging.X-ray Pelvis: Left subcapital femoral neck fracture, Garden III

primary_diagnosis: Left femoral neck fracture (Garden III), dehydration, on anticoagulation
correct_treatment: Pain management (avoid NSAIDs, use acetaminophen + low-dose opioid)
Orthopedic surgery consult (hemiarthroplasty preferred for displaced)

chief_complaint: I think I have ADHD and Tourette's — I saw it on TikTok
hpi_full: 17F brought by mother requesting ADHD and Tourette evaluation. Recently developed tic-like movements after watching TikTok videos about Tourette syndrome. Movements are complex, distractible, and stop when patient is unaware of being observed. Functional tic-like behaviors vs mass sociogenic illness.
onset: 3 weeks ago after watching TikTok videos
character: Complex movements — arm flinging, coprolalia-like utterances
alleviating: When alone and not being filmed

social_history.school: B student, no behavioral issues prior
social_history.social: Recent peer group all report similar symptoms

ros_negative: No ADHD symptoms prior to social media exposure

physical_exam.general: Well-appearing adolescent, complex motor movements noted
physical_exam.neuro: Movements stop when patient is distracted, suggestible, inconsistent pattern, no premonitory urge reported

primary_diagnosis: Functional tic-like disorder (mass sociogenic illness via social media)
differential_diagnoses: Tourette syndrome (unlikely — onset >18, no childhood tics)
correct_workup: Detailed history of symptom onset relative to social media exposure
Neurological exam (distinguish functional from organic tics)
correct_treatment: Education about functional neurological symptoms (without invalidating)
Reduce social media exposure (especially tic content)
